content.text:
# Togo–United Kingdom relations

Togo–United Kingdom relations refer to the bilateral relations between Togo and the United Kingdom. The bilateral relationship is characterised by cooperation in areas including development assistance, trade, security, education, and regional diplomacy in West Africa.
Both countries share common membership of the Atlantic Co-operation Pact, the Commonwealth, and the World Trade Organization. Bilaterally the two countries have a Commercial Debts Treaty.
History
The UK occupied Togo from 1914 to 1916, when Togo became a French mandate.
Diplomatic missions
*Togo maintains a high commission in London.
*The United Kingdom is not accredited to Togo through a high commission; the UK is represented through its high commission in Accra, Ghana.
See also
* Foreign relations of Togo
* Foreign relations of the United Kingdom
